title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 220.5 - Severability and Authorization to Act
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 220.5 - Severability and Authorization to Act

State Regulations
(a) If any portion of this Part or the
application thereof to any person or circumstances is adjudged invalid by any
court of competent jurisdiction, such judgment shall be confined in its
operation to the specific portion or application directly involved in the
controversy in which such judgment shall have been rendered. Such controversy
or judgment shall not affect or impair the validity of the remainder of this

Part or the application thereof to other persons or circumstances. (b) For purposes of this Part, any act or
activity of the executive director of the agency, any person designated by him
or her, or other such employee of the agency shall be deemed an act or activity
of the agency. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
220.5

Adopted

New

York State Register February 7, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 6, eff. 2/7/2024

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
